headline: Amazing Whole Wheat Pizza Crust
description: This whole wheat pizza dough bakes up into an amazing crust that's crisp on the outside, soft and chewy on the inside. Perfect for any pizza toppings!

video.description: See how to make a healthy and delicious pizza crust.
video.name: Amazing Whole Wheat Pizza Crust

name: Amazing Whole Wheat Pizza Crust
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)

recipeInstructions.text: Pour warm water into a large bowl; stir in sugar to dissolve. Sprinkle yeast on top and let stand until foamy, about 10 minutes.
Stir olive oil and salt into yeast mixture; mix in whole wheat flour and 1 cup all-purpose flour until dough starts to come together.
Turn dough out onto a surface floured with remaining all-purpose flour; knead until all of the flour has been absorbed and dough becomes smooth, about 10 minutes.
Place dough in an oiled bowl and turn to coat the surface. Cover loosely with a towel; let stand in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.
Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface; divide into 2 pieces for 2 thin crusts, or leave whole to make one thick crust.
Form dough into a tight ball; place dough back into an oiled bowl and turn to coat the surface. Cover loosely with a towel; let stand in a warm place until doubled in size, about 45 minutes.

Grease a large pizza pan. Roll a ball of dough with a rolling pin until it will not stretch any further. Then, drape it over both of your fists, and gently pull the edges outward, while rotating crust. When the circle has reached the desired size, place on the prepared pizza pan.

review.reviewBody: Excellent recipe, used 00 flour instead of regular flour. Great combination between whole wheat and regular flour. Thank you
it was the best homemade pizza I have ever made
I like to use honey instead of sugar and it was fine.
Best whole wheat pizza crust recipe so far. I tried a couple , but this one is the best.

I made this pizza dough alongside regular dough for the first time in my life. The regular dough turned out fine, but this dough teared when rolling, stuck to the pan and came out more like a brownie consistency than a pizza dough. I'm not sure if it's something that I did wrong or it's the recipe itself - I followed the instructions as written and let sit both doughs the same. Only thing that I converted the measurements from cups and such to grams - maybe that's what messed it up. I'm not sure about it. 
I'd maybe try it again, but I'd have to change something.

Amazing! Did today for Mother’s Day! And baked them in smaller sizes! Kids loved it! Tried to added a photo but there is problem with size guess my camera is too big or I just can’t get the right size
I made this recipe as written and it turned out great! This will be my new go-to crust recipe!
Great pizza crust and easy to make. I followed the recipe. The only thing I did different was use my stand mixer to kneed the dough. Baked on a kamado grill for about 8 - 9 minutes at 450 degrees.

This has become our go -to home made pizza crust. I mix it up on the dough setting in my bread machine and it makes two med pizza crusts. I add a tsp of minced garlic and tbls of parmesan to the dough. Love it, thank you!

I made this recipe twice and both times it turned out amazing. The second time when I made it I also read the reviews and the recommendations in those reviews. Baking the pizza crust for first 10 mins made the pizza crust more crunchy. Thank you for this lovely recipe.
This is our new go-to pizza dough. I did as others suggested with using only whole wheat. It turns out perfect. I also cut the recipe in half because this recipe is enough for two pies.
Very easy to make and it was absolutely delicious. I made it exactly like the recipes says, therefore, an honest rating.

Great recipe. 
The base turned out fantastic.
Great!!

I too converted the flour to all whole wheat using 3 1/4 cups weighed out in grams to make less dense. Think it was 380. Then I separated out in five sections and made personal pizzas in the air fryer. 375 for 7-10 minutes depending on thickness or how long the oven was on. A huge success! I have made this before on pizza stone and found it gummy, but the air fryer made the outside crusty and the inside chewy. I did roll the dough extra thin due to my last go with this recipe. Perfect for a hot day when you want pizza but not a hot house

I made this in my bread machine on the dough setting. Baked it Chicago style with a garlic butter brushed pan. FANTASTIC!! Crispy crust, chewy body, and great flavor. Will become a regular in my rotation.
left out the all purpose flour completely as recommended by some reviews and crust was amazing! add herbs for taste

I have made this pizza crust three times and each time I add a little more oil and water because I have a hard time rolling out the dough in one piece. It's delicious and it works really well with our vegan and vegetarian varieties of pizza!
Would definitely make it again.

I think you should not label "whole" wheat when it isn't whole wheat, but partly wheat. I had already started cooking it before realizing it was not whole wheat. I would have picked a different recipe. I finished anyways and it taster delicous! Great recipe but I would suggest just calling it wheat crust instead of whole wheat crust.
This made one of the best pizzas I have ever had. The dough is easy to make . I divided it half and placed the other half in the freezer for another day.

Tonight I figured out how to make astounding homemade pizza crust. I followed this recipe but brought water temp between 115 and 120, and let the second rising of the dough go for 6hours in the fridge
Very very good. Super impressed! If I plan ahead no need for store or delivery pizza.

Technically not whole wheat, but for a healthier pizza crust it was great! Super thick if you don't divide into 2. I used melted butter instead of olive oil and added Italian seasonings. Next time I want to try making the dough in bread machine and have it thinner. Also after baking I want to brush the outer crust with butter for a little more flavor. I'm trying to find a tasty healthy crust so I don't eat delivery pizza though.
It’s really good. My kids love it. We put the crust in the oven for five minutes before adding toppings. We also don’t let the pizza rise as long as they recommend if I don’t have enough time.
Great recipe! I place my pizza stone in the oven and preheat it at 550 degrees and bake the pizza for 10 minutes.

so good ! took others advice and substituted honey for sugar, and all wheat flour (3 1/4 c). did a pre cook of dough 500° for 5 minutes. then put toppings and put in oven again for 15 min at 400°. I used it to make mini pizzas
It was amazing! Kids and hubby all loved it. Perfect size crust. I only let it double in size then rolled it onto the pan.
Amazing recipe! I used whole wheat flour entirely and it turned out great.
I thought it was bland. The husband thought it was tough. The only reason I tried this was because I couldn't find my copycat Mellow Mushroom crust. I will go back to my original recipe.

I've made a few different pizza doughs. This one is, by far, the most elastic. It tastes great and the finished texture is fantasic. I cut the recipe in half as I wanted to make a smaller pizza and the dough rose in about 1/2 hour each time. It still filled a smaller size rectangular cookie sheet. I definitely will use this recipe again.
This is a great recipe

Made it using completely out of whole wheat flour instead of using all purpose flour . Works beautifully. Family loved it. Added grated cheese and boccochini cheese with bell peppers , zucchini and basil leaves as toppings. My go to recipe for a pizza crust now on. Thanks so much.
loved it great dough thanks

Just what I was looking for. I followed these modifications due to dietary needs.

Incredible! I modified the recipe a little using only whole wheat flour (3 1/4 cups) and substituted honey for the sugar. I an extra teaspoon of salt and added 1 t. italian seasoning to the dough for added flavor. I put the ingredients in the bread machine on the dough setting and let it do the work for me!! I precooked the crust for 5 min at 500 degrees and then added the ingredients and cooked it for an additional 14 minutes at 425. Pizza came out PERFECT! even those at the table who were skeptical of whole wheat crust RAVED about this recipe. we will be making this one again and again!

made it but FORGOT the olive oil!! My family & I spread the crust with olive oil before baking & the kids scarfed it down...husband said it was OK. (I am GF so I didn't try it) Probably not the most helpful review...
This shall now be my go to recipe for pizza crust, it was marvelous as thin crust and it was still great as a thicker crust. I did it just as the recipe said. Highly recommended :)
Delicious. I will make it again & again.

This is a pretty good recipe. It is easy to double and has a light flavor. I was in a time crunch, so I didn't let it rise for a full hour before making pizza with it. The dough rises nicely, is crisp on the outside, and light on the inside. I will be making this recipe again. In time I am sure I will tweak it somehow, just because I like to tinker with recipes, but as it stands, this is a solid go-to recipe.

Followed the instructions to the letter. The dough turned out ok. You really need to divide into 4 if you are making thin crust pizzas. My crust still turned out rather thick. It cooked and crisped up nicely, but really lacked in flavour. Needs more salt or some herbs perhaps. No matter what toppings you put on, nothing can make up for a bland crust.

This crust was very easy to make. I had never made pizza dough before and I would call it a success. The crust has a good flavor and crisps up well; I did the thin crust version. The crust does not become cracker-like as some other thin crusts do, so don't make my mistake of putting too much sauce or toppings on your pizza. The crust isn't strong enough for that. Less is more in this case it seems. Good crust overall though!

I made this recipe but with a few changes. I left out the sugar, and used whole wheat flour only. Same amount of flour, just whole wheat only. Also I didn't wait for the dough to rise, I just mixed it kneaded it and rolled it out. Rolled it thin and baked for 20 min. Made for a great this crust, whole wheat pizza crust!

This makes plenty and it is easy to handle but it is kind of tasteless and bakes up dry and hard. I think there is probably a better option out there. This was my first whole wheat pizza crust, so I could be wrong. I

This makes plenty and it is easy to handle but it is kind of tasteless and bakes up dry and hard. I think there is probably a better option out there. This was my first whole wheat pizza crust, so I could be wrong. I

I thoroughly enjoyed using this recipe. I have been searching for a tasty whole wheat crust recipe for a long time, and this is one of the best I have found. We often have a pizza night at the house. Everyone gets their own dough and makes whatever they want on their individual pizza. This recipe makes 5-6 individual crusts, which is perfect for our family. We've used this recipe several times now, all successful The most important step in this recipe IMHO is that second rise. Don't skip or skimp on that step - you'll regret it if you do. No substitutions needed - this is a winner!
This was the best ever
Very Bland and dry! Did not rise as well as it should! Modified the recipe completely, turned out much better! Do not waste your time with this version.

I made this dough and absolutely loved it. I did add 1 tbs oregano, 1 tbs basil, 1 tsp cinnamon. I baked the crust for 5 minutes at 500 before adding toppings, then for about 9 minutes at 425 with toppings. The cinnamon definitely made the dough a little sweeter. We have big pizza fans in our family and everyone absolutely loved this crust. :)

This was the best pizza crust I've ever made. I added a little ground flax, heaping TB corn meal and some italian seasoning, dumped it all in my bread machine and let it do the work. Very good and will repeat.

I'm an inexperienced baker & have to use my KitchenAid mixer with dough hook for kneading (I have tendonitis). Following the recipe, my dough "ball" after ten minutes of kneading was still really shaggy. I added more white flour, kneaded some more, repeated that. Finally I gave up, dumping the sticky, shaggy mess into the bowl. I had to add more olive oil to keep it from sticking to the bowl. So I have a giant shaggy wad of olive oil goo over there in a bowl! No idea how it's going to turn out.
I made the recipe as is, and it was FANTASTIC!!!!

It tasted very good, stayed fluffy and soft, I'm very happy with the results. Made the dough with Whole Wheat flour and separated it into quarters to make personal pizzas. I made 3, with a homemade sauce and used the last quarter to make tiny pizza bites that looked like calzones. The dough was a little tough to get thin enough for my son's taste but that could just mean that I need practice. :-) The pizza bites were a little hard to do too, couldn't get enough sauce and cheese inside.
I followed the recipe but used my bread maker on dough setting. Turned out great.
Very easy to make. I added the salt to the flour as opposed to adding it to the yeast mixture, as I did not want the salt to 'kill' the yeast.

Excellent recipe! I used 3 1/4 whole wheat flour only (+ 1/2 c for the kneading, which btw was made in 5 minutes using a stand mixer). Got 2 thin pizza crusts (13" & 15") and baked them first at 500 F for 5 minutes, then added de ingredients and baked at 425 F for 10-14 min as some reviewers suggested. Thanks for sharing, will definitely make again!
Every Friday we made this recipe!
great dough and is my go to. Only change I make is I substitute honey for the sugar.
I had to freeze it in the middle of it rising in the bowl, but it was still really good. My family loved it and I would definitely make it again.

That was amazing! :)) I really look forward to trying it every time I get a pizza craving for my little ones, this one will be our favorite choice! :D Thanks so much for a wonderful healthy receipe experience!

Loved this. It worked well in the bread machine on the dough setting. I did add a little oregano and basil and cooked it for a few minutes before adding the toppings like others suggested. Will definitely make again and again!

I followed along with other reviewers and omitted the all purpose flour in favor of using all white whole wheat flour. I kept the 1 tsp of sugar instead of using honey. I split the dough into two crusts and got two thin crusted ovals about 10 inches long. Plenty of food for 5 people! Loved the crunchy outside and slight softness of the inside. I'd make it again.

I would recommend this recipe to anyone! I bought a bread maker just to try this recipe and my family loves it! I followed the recommendation of other reviews for wheat flour only and it turned out perfect! My family and I are going to try this for "Family Night"!

We made this crust tonight except we took advice from another reviewer and used 3 1/4 c whole wheat flour instead of the all purpose. It was EXCELLENT. We also kneaded in some Italian seasoning and garlic powder to the dough which worked out very well. Highly recommend!
I used only whole wheat flour with this recipe and it still turned out good.

This was my first attempt at making pizza dough. I did use all whole wheat flour and honey instead of sugar. My hands wimped out at kneading so I used a dough hook to do the work after the first rise. The dough seemed dry, I had to play with liquids to get what I thought was the right texture/consistency. Did bake for 5 minutes at 500 and then added toppings and finished at 425 like reviewers suggested. It made 4 personal pizzas, at Boboli size, it was crispy on the outside and chewy inside. I actually oiled three dough balls and froze them, made one a week later, and still just as good. The last two I am going to roll thinner to see if I can get more crisp than chew. And next time will add spices to the crust. Overall a great basic recipe.
Excellent pizza crust! The dough was just slightly on the dry side as it was coming together so I did end up adding a little bit extra olive oil to pull it together. Definitely a keeper!

I substituted 2 cups (risen) sour dough starter and 
1 /2 cup of white flour 
and only used 1 cup of warm water 
turned out great ....

I make homemade crust all the time but this is a winner! I used King Arthur white whole wheat flour for the whole wheat and regular AP flour. Followed recipe exactly except for adding salt with the flour not with the yeast. The dough rose beautifully and was so easy to work with. I've made this 3 times in the past 2 weeks and intend to make it again this week. The texture is light which I didn't expect with the whole wheat and so delicious. My family loves it so goodbye to all other recipes. After spreading the dough onto my greased pizza pans, I bake at 450-500 for about 10 minutes to precook the pizza before adding sauce and cheese. I might even freeze the precooked crusts for the next party to make my life easier!

Great recipe! Much better than the pre-made pizza doughs. 
This is the perfect amount of dough for two medium sized pizzas with a crust not too thin or deep. Didn't change a thing, however, I did need to cook it in the oven for longer than the reccommended time.
The only substitution I made was honey for sugar. The flavor was good and the instructions produced a very good thin crust when divided into two pizzas.

I made this and loved it. I put it on the pizza pan and put it in the oven while the oven was heating up to the right temp. When the oven was at temp, I pulled it out and put on the sauce and toppings, and then baked it. The crust was incredibly crusty (I hate soggy, doughy crust). I will make this over and over again!
There wasn't much flavor to it. I'll keep looking.

Great crust! The only thing I added was a half tsp of garlic powder to give it a little extra zip. In response to another reviewer's comment: You are referring to whole grain wheat not whole wheat. White flour is in fact 100% wheat, it is just not 100% of the wheat (ie. including the germ, bran, etc.). Commercially ground whole grain wheat flour is not available in the US. Even the flour labeled as such is actually only white flour that has had some of the bran and germ added back. The only way to get true whole grain flour is to grind it yourself, which I do. This receipe is equally tasty made either way.

This is my all-time favourite pizza dough recipe. I have tried several, and none even come close to this. As someone who was scared to try making pizza dough for years due to the assumption of it being challenging, this recipe has proved me wrong! Super easy, fool proof even. Everyone who has tried it absolutely loves it. Thank you for a great recipe!

I think for a simple, healthy, whole wheat crust (I used 3.25 cups of white whole wheat flour and added NO white flour, subbed honey for sugar, and added 1tsp of salt), this is a consistent recipe. I have made it several times, and it's not my kids favorite compared to a white flour crust, but they still eat it happily and it's better for them! It always turns out the same. I love recipes you can depend on.

My large family loves homemade pizza, and we are always on the lookout for a whole wheat twist on things we love. This recipe did not disappoint! The texture was wonderful, crispy on the outside and chewy on the inside. We tossed it, dusted the bottom with cornmeal, then baked it on a pizza tray (not a stone) at 325 for 10 minutes, THEN added toppings and baked 10 minutes more. It came out perfect. The second time we made it, we added some spices to the dough, and a little honey and it came out very good that way as well. Very versatile. Thank you for a wonderful share!
Made exactly as written and will make again!!!
This is the only recipe I use for my BLT pizza. Its not whole wheat as it contains White flour but even without changing the recipe it is great!
Our first ever whole wheat pizza crust. Delicious!!!

This was an ideal recipe. The only additions I made were fresh chopped garlic and fresh basil in the dough. the crust was thin, but chewy and crisp at the same time. For my topping I roasted red peppers, eggplant, mushroom and onions, plus chicken sausage. raves reviews all around.
better than I expected, even with multi toppings, crust held up.

So I read the reviews and used 3 3/4 cup whole wheat flour. I forgot to let it rise the second time and it still came out great! I made two batches and froze the second batch prior to second rise. I will just thaw it and let it rise before cooking it. Everyone loved it, and using a food processor made it a breeze.

I also altered this recipe to my particular diet and tastes, but it was fantastic! It did need more seasoning so I doubled the salt,but I make a vegan pizza with only sauce and veggies so it may not be needed with traditional pizza toppings. 

I also eat low fat so I eliminated the oils. I cook the pizza on parchment paper to make it oil-free nonstick. I also eliminated the all purpose flour and increased the whole wheat. I ended up with 3 1/4 cups of whole wheat flour, more or less may be needed depending on humidity. I swapped out the sugar for honey. A very adaptable recipe anyone can play with and enjoy in good health. It was a breeze to make. Thank you!

I really like this recipe a lot - I will not buy store-bough pizza crusts again! I made a couple of adjustments - some due to preference and some for my breadmaker. I used all whole-wheat flour - 3 1/4 cups and I usually have to add an additional 1-2 tablespoons of water during the kneading phase to get the dough the right consistency. I use a teaspoon of honey instead of white sugar, and sometimes I add a tablespoon of Italian seasoning to the mix. Set the breadmaker on the dough setting, and this makes enough for 2 large thin crusts. I bake the crust for 5-6 minutes at 475 degrees, then add topping and cook for another 10-12 minutes. I usually use 1 crust and freeze the other for the next week. To thaw, I put it in the fridge for a day & let it set on the counter for 30 minutes before using. Seriously, after making this, I see no reason to buy dough or crusts anymore!

Made this crust following the exact recipe and wow! Never gonna make another pizza dough again besides this one! Letting it rise for the whole amount of time is crucial for it to come out súper soft and perfectly chewy- conpliment with vegan cheese for a truly healthy and absolutely delicious pizza!

It was my first time making pizza from scratch. This recipe is amazing and easy to make. I wanted to make a thin pizza so I used only half the dough and saved the other half in the fridge for future use. The wheat pizza crust was easy to roll and the crust turned out perfectly! The crust is slightly crunchy on the edge and soft and chewy inside. I will try this recipe again using my dough hook next time. Also I may use only a third of the dough next time to see if the crust will turn crunchy. 

If this is the only pizza crust recipe you want to try, this recipe is the one for you! It is a wheat crust so it is tasty and healthy for your whole family too!
Not worth making two crusts- just one big one is good.
Our family makes pizza at least twice a month. I have tried several crust recipes but this has become our favorite. It also reheats very well.

our best pizza crust yet! used Hodgson Mill 50/50 whole wheat/white for all of the flour. put down corn meal on the pizza pan before baking. rolled out extra thin. added a little honey. maybe a tablespoon. awesome!! used a pizza stone and baked at 450. cook the crust first until crispy and then add toppings and bake.

I finally found it! Recently I changed my family's diet from white to brown. My kids love pizza and were begging for take out. I have been trying different whole grain recipes and they didn't cut it with them until now! WE HAVE A WINNER!!! Thank you!

I have made this many times. My whole family loves it. I like it just the way it is. Our new favorite is to split the dough in two and use half of the dough to make breadsticks. I make the Cheese Dipping Sauce (with some modifications) from this site to go along with it. The only problem I have is I can't help but eat to much!

Awesome! This was my first time making pizza dough, and I've always been a fan of the whole wheat stuff. My boyfriend loves it. I used Just 1 cup of all-purpose flour and subbed an extra (just under) half a cup of whole wheat for the remaining AP. I bake at 425F for 16 minutes, then broiled on low for another four minutes. My crust was medium thickness. I like thin but I was too lazy to put the work into making it thinner, plus I had already rationed out the dough and that's the size that allowed two pizzas to fit on one baking sheet. I do not have a pizza stone, but after having this pizza I just don't see the need.

I have made this dough a few times. I like to substitute the sugar for a bit of honey also sometimes switching out the water for a little beer.. I throw cooked chicken and the works on my pizza and top it with mozzarella. It always turns out amazing!

I was pleasantly surprised with this recipe. I always associated whole wheat pizza dough as being somewhat dense like making whole wheat bread is. It was delicious. Same chewy texture as with bread flour ( I used a pizza stone) and I also used all whole wheat. Awesome. I was scared to try, but we are going with this recipe from now on

I tried this last night and really enjoyed it, my husband not so much. But, he still is into white bread and doesn't care for wheat anything. I made it the night before and stuck the dough in the fridge for the next night. It was a little bland, but that's the beauty of a base recipe. Next time I will add more salt, garlic, herbs and all wheat flour(since it looks like it will just be me eating it). Very simple to make and so much cheaper than buying the pre-made crust. Thanks!
It was just ok. Whole wheat flour has a strong taste to me. It didn't go well with the goat cheese, pesto, arugala pizza I made.

Taste Amazing and my boyfriend who is super picky asked if I could make it into a bread as well. He loved it. 
I made a artichoke heart, spinach, chicken, canadian bacon, olive pizza with it.
So smooth and perfect, just the way dough should be...

First time it was fabulous i used a pizza pan with vent holes in the bottom of the pan. Best scratch pizza dough rolled outer crust edge with cheese inside. Yum yum!
Seakeen
